translations.chinese: 今軍吏計功，以天下為不足用遍封，而恐以過失及誅，故相聚謀反耳。」
translations.english: Now the army officers calculate merit, considering the world insufficient to universally enfeoff, and fear that faults will lead to execution, so they gather to plot rebellion."
The emperor said: "What should be done?"

translations.chinese: 良曰：「取上素所不快，計群臣所共知最甚者一人，先封以示群臣。」
translations.english: Liang said: "Take one whom the emperor has always disliked, whom the ministers all know had the greatest faults, and enfeoff him first to show the ministers."

translations.chinese: 三月，上置酒，封雍齒，因趣丞相急定功行封。
translations.english: In the third month, the emperor held a banquet and enfeoffed Yong Chi. He then urged the chancellor to quickly determine merit and carry out enfeoffments.

translations.chinese: 罷酒，群臣皆喜，曰：「雍齒且侯， 吾屬亡患矣！」
translations.english: The banquet ended. All the ministers were happy, saying: "Even Yong Chi is made marquis. We have no worries!"
